alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Leake; Neshoba; Newton; Scott; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 10:15AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LEAKE...NORTHWESTERN JASPER...NEWTON...NORTHERN SMITH...EASTERN SCOTT AND SOUTHERN NESHOBA COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 AM CST... At 1014 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sebastopol to near Lake to near Raleigh. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Conehatta, Lake, Sebastopol, Prospect, and Pineville around 1020 AM CST. Dixon and Lawrence around 1025 AM CST. Newton and Roberts around 1030 AM CST. Union, Stratton, and Neshoba around 1035 AM CST. Decatur and Montrose around 1040 AM CST. Tucker, Garlandville, and Bethsaida around 1045 AM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Jasper; Leake; Neshoba; Newton; Scott; Smith
